name: Date Night Lemon Pappardelle with Shrimp
description: Lemon Pappardelle with Shrimp! Creamy, lemony, silky pasta piled high in a bowl with buttery shrimp and freshly cracked black pepper. Everything you need for date night! ❤️
keywords: date night pasta, lemon pasta, shrimp pasta, date night recipe, lemon shrimp
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon fresh garlic, grated (less than one clove)
1/4 to 1/2 cup white wine (I usually eyeball it)
8 ounces pappardelle or fettuccini pasta (egg pasta or fresh pasta – yum)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook according to package directions (add a big pinch of salt to your water for better-tasting pasta). Drain and reserve some water. Toss pasta with olive oil to prevent sticking.
recipeInstructions.name: Pasta

video.name: Lemon Pasta Step 1
video.description: Cook according to package directions (add a big pinch of salt to your water for better-tasting pasta). Drain and reserve some water. Toss pasta with olive oil to prevent sticking.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt 2-3 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add the garlic; sauté for 1-2 minutes (do not brown the garlic). Add the wine; let it sizzle out for a few minutes. Add the cream; bring to a simmer. Add the lemon juice, salt, and optional Parmesan; bring down to low heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce

video.name: Lemon Pasta Step 2
video.description: Melt 2-3 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add the garlic; sauté for 1-2 minutes (do not brown the garlic). Add the wine; let it sizzle out for a few minutes. Add the cream; bring to a simmer. Add the lemon juice, salt, and optional Parmesan; bring down to low heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Pat shrimp dry with paper towels. Heat one tablespoon of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp, season with salt, and flip when pink (1-2 minutes per side). Cover with foil and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Shrimp

video.name: Lemon Pasta Step 3
video.description: Pat shrimp dry with paper towels. Heat one tablespoon of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp, season with salt, and flip when pink (1-2 minutes per side). Cover with foil and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss your pasta with the warm sauce. Serve alongside a pile of fresh, juicy, hot, buttery shrimp. Serve with freshly cracked black pepper and little wedges of lemon. Ooooh baby.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble

video.name: Lemon Pasta Step 4
video.description: Toss your pasta with the warm sauce. Serve alongside a pile of fresh, juicy, hot, buttery shrimp. Serve with freshly cracked black pepper and little wedges of lemon. Ooooh baby.

video.name: Date Night Lemon Pappardelle with Shrimp
video.description: Lemon Pappardelle with Shrimp! Creamy, lemony, silky pasta piled high in a bowl with buttery shrimp and freshly cracked black pepper.

review.reviewBody: What a great and simple idea for a date night. Thanks for sharing.
No flavor to the shrimp! No red pepper? No brining? Basil, anything. Very bland, sorry.
I was nervous about blandness too, but the garlic, lemon, and parmesan made this both delicate and delicious.

This recipe looks delish! But can I ask a potentially dumb question?  Why don't chefs, restaurants... etc.  take the tails of shrimp?  Especially when its a dish like this, with twirly pasta?? I have never understood this.  Do people actually eat the tails?
Thank you for this recipe. I haven’t cooked this dish before. Today I’ll try to cook
Made this tonight. So fast, easy and delicious.
This looks so delicious! I’m inspired, and I’ve been thinking about what to make for Valentine’s Day. This could be the winner!
The recipe was delicious! My husband, four year old, and two year old loved it! Thanks!!!!
This was excellent.  Made it for Valentine’s Day for my 93 year old mom and husband. Huge hit!  Had 12 Oz pasta so increased sauce by half. This would be great even without the shrimp.
This was sooo delicious! Best pasta dish I’ve ever made. Thank you so much!

So simple, yet so good! Quick recipe and creamy, but not too creamy. I used chicken broth instead of white wine, since I didn’t have any wine and I finished the fish off with more ground pepper, fresh parsley, Parmesan and red pepper flakes. Will definitely be making again!
This is delicious. It’s restaurant worthy and so easy to make. We’ll make this often.
My husband I loved this dish!  The sauce paired well with the shrimp. Loved the lemon, I used 2T and added the optional Parmesan!  We will definitely make this again!

Hello! I’m excited to try this recipe tonight! (I’ll be using red wine instead of white so I hope it goes well) Stupid question: when you reserve some of the water from cooking the pasta, do you let the pasta sit in it while you’re cooking the shrimp? Or do you set aside some of the pasta water for the sauce? It’s not clear in the recipe. Thanks!
